sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand PLENDIL, containing Felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand PLENDIL,
Drug Label for drug brand PLENDIL,

sentence.text: Hypotension Felodipine, like other calcium antagonists, may occasionally precipitate significant hypotension and, rarely, syncope.
Caution, therefore, should be exercised when using PLENDIL in patients with heart failure or compromised ventricular function, particularly in combination with a beta blocker.

Patients with Impaired Liver Function Patients with impaired liver function may have elevated plasma concentrations of felodipine and may respond to lower doses of PLENDIL, therefore, a starting dose of 2.5 mg once a day is recommended.

Co-administration of CYP3A4 inhibitors (eg, ketoconazole, itraconazole, erythromycin, grapefruit juice, cimetidine) with felodipine may lead to several-fold increases in the plasma levels of felodipine, either due to an increase in bioavailability or due to a decrease in metabolism.

mmtx.phraseText: increases in the plasma levels of felodipine,
increases in the plasma levels of felodipine,

sentence.text: These increases in concentration may lead to increased effects, (lower blood pressure and increased heart rate).

ellipsisSentence.text: Co-administration of CYP3A4 inhibitors (eg, ketoconazole, itraconazole, erythromycin, grapefruit juice, cimetidine) with felodipine may lead to several-fold increases in the plasma levels of felodipine, either due to an increase in bioavailability or due to a decrease in metabolism.

Co-administration of CYP3A4 inhibitors (eg, ketoconazole, itraconazole, erythromycin, grapefruit juice, cimetidine) with felodipine may lead to several-fold increases in the plasma levels of felodipine, either due to an increase in bioavailability or due to a decrease in metabolism.

sentence.text: These effects have been observed with co-administration of itraconazole (a potent CYP3A4 inhibitor).

middleSentence.text: These increases in concentration may lead to increased effects, (lower blood pressure and increased heart rate).

sentence.text: Caution should be used when CYP3A4 inhibitors are co-administered with felodipine.

<item>Itraconazole Co-administration of another extended release formulation of felodipine with itraconazole resulted in approximately 8-fold increase in the AUC, more than 6-fold increase in the Cmax, and 2-fold prolongation in the half-life of felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: 2-fold prolongation in the half-life of felodipine.
>Itraconazole Co-administration of another extended release formulation of felodipine

sentence.text: <item>Erythromycin Co-administration of felodipine (PLENDIL) with erythromycin resulted in approximately 2.5-fold increase in the AUC and Cmax, and about 2-fold prolongation in the half-life of felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: about 2-fold prolongation in the half-life of felodipine.

sentence.text: <item>Grapefruit juice Co-administration of felodipine with grapefruit juice resulted in more than 2-fold increase in the AUC and Cmax, but no prolongation in the half-life of felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: no prolongation in the half-life of felodipine.

sentence.text: <item>Cimetidine Co-administration of felodipine with cimetidine (a non-specific CYP-450 inhibitor) resulted in an increase of approximately 50% in the AUC and the Cmax, of felodipine.
<item>Beta-Blocking Agents A pharmacokinetic study of felodipine in conjunction with metoprolol demonstrated no significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: no significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of felodipine.

sentence.text: The AUC and Cmax of metoprolol, however, were increased approximately 31 and 38%, respectively.

ellipsisSentence.text: <item>Beta-Blocking Agents A pharmacokinetic study of felodipine in conjunction with metoprolol demonstrated no significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: no significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of felodipine.

ellipsisSentence.text: <item>Beta-Blocking Agents A pharmacokinetic study of felodipine in conjunction with metoprolol demonstrated no significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of felodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: no significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of felodipine.

sentence.text: In controlled clinical trials, however, beta blockers including metoprolol were concurrently administered with felodipine and were well tolerated.
<item>Digoxin When given concomitantly with PLENDIL the pharmacokinetics of digoxin in patients with heart failure were not significantly altered.

<item>Anticonvulsants In a pharmacokinetic study, maximum plasma concentrations of felodipine were considerably lower in epileptic patients on long-term anticonvulsant therapy (eg, phenytoin, carbamazepine, or phenobarbital) than in healthy volunteers.
In such patients, the mean area under the felodipine plasma concentration-time curve was also reduced to approximately 6% of that observed in healthy volunteers.

entity.text: the mean area under the plasma concentration-time curve was also reduced

mmtx.phraseText: the mean area under the felodipine plasma concentration-time curve
the mean area under the felodipine plasma concentration-time curve

ellipsisSentence.text: <item>Anticonvulsants In a pharmacokinetic study, maximum plasma concentrations of felodipine were considerably lower in epileptic patients on long-term anticonvulsant therapy (eg, phenytoin, carbamazepine, or phenobarbital) than in healthy volunteers.

sentence.text: <item>Tacrolimus Felodipine may increase the blood concentration of tacrolimus.
When given concomitantly with felodipine, the tacrolimus blood concentration should be followed and the tacrolimus dose may need to be adjusted.

entity.text: dose may need to be adjusted

sentence.text: <item>Other Concomitant Therapy In healthy subjects there were no clinically significant interactions when felodipine was given concomitantly with indomethacin or spironolactone.

In a 2-year carcinogenicity study in rats fed felodipine at doses of 7.7, 23.1 or 69.3 mg/kg/day (up to 61 times Based on patient weight of 50 kg the maximum recommended human dose on a mg/m2 basis), a dose-related increase in the incidence of benign interstitial cell tumors of the testes (Leydig cell tumors) was observed in treated male rats.

mmtx.phraseText: human dose on a mg/m2 basis

sentence.text: Felodipine, at the doses employed in the 2-year rat study, has been shown to lower testicular testosterone and to produce a corresponding increase in serum luteinizing hormone in rats.

mmtx.phraseText: a corresponding increase in serum luteinizing hormone

sentence.text: Felodipine was not carcinogenic when fed to mice at doses up to 138.6 mg/kg/day (61 times1 the maximum recommended human dose on a mg/m2 basis) for periods of up to 80 weeks in males and 99 weeks in females.

mmtx.phraseText: human dose on a mg/m2 basis

sentence.text: A fertility study in which male and female rats were administered doses of 3.8, 9.6 or 26.9 mg/kg/day (up to 24 times1 the maximum recommended human dose on a mg/m2 basis) showed no significant effect of felodipine on reproductive performance.

mmtx.phraseText: human dose on a mg/m2 basis
